title: What jobs can one get with a Master's degree in Science and Technology Policy? - Quora

response.answer_text: While there are certainly plenty of government positions and think tanks where this degree is highly valued, for specific companies and possible career paths you can look at Technology Policy alumni profiles from various programs, below. MIT: http://tppserver.mit.edu/index.php?id=108CMU: http://www.epp.cmu.edu/people/alumni.htmlBerkeley: http://www.ischool.berkeley.edu/careers/pathsGeorgia Tech: http://www.spp.gatech.edu/bachelor/alumniprofilesIST-Lisbon: http://in3.dem.ist.utl.pt/master/references/Cambridge: http://www.jbs.cam.ac.uk/programmes/mphil_techpol/careers.html

Kimble McCraw has provided great advice and valuable resources. I am a graduate of University of Cambridge's Technology Policy programme that she mentions in her list. Fellow alumni have gone into a diverse range of jobs including: a) working at international agencies such as IAEA and NATOb) working in investment banking and private equity, and roles advising these sectors, sometimes with a specialist focus on regulated technology led industriesc) quasi-political roles such as advisory or research support positions to elected legislators and representativesd) academic research and teaching in their home countriese) private sector management consulting Hope these help. Also see my reply to the question (link: Where can I find technology policy jobs?) for further ideas. Thanks.
